questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a Hardware Description Language (HDL) like Verilog or VHDL in digital IC design?
options: To physically manufacture silicon wafers in a fabrication plant.
To describe the behavior, structure, and connectivity of electronic circuits for synthesis and simulation.
To write operating system code for embedded processors.
To perform finite element analysis for thermal modeling of chip packages.
To manage project timelines and resource allocation in a design team.

questions.question: In the context of pipelined processors, what is a 'data hazard' primarily caused by?
options: Multiple instructions attempting to access the same hardware resource simultaneously.
A conditional branch instruction causing the pipeline to fetch instructions from an incorrect path.
An instruction attempting to use data that has not yet been computed or made available by a preceding instruction.
The processor fetching an invalid or corrupted instruction from memory.
Insufficient capacity in the processor's register file to store all intermediate results.

questions.question: Which technique is primarily used in advanced System-on-Chip (SoC) power management to completely cut off power to inactive functional blocks, thereby eliminating both static and dynamic power consumption in those regions?
options: Dynamic Voltage and Frequency Scaling (DVFS)
Clock Gating
Pipeline Flushing
Power Gating
Cache Coherence Protocols

questions.question: What is the fundamental difference in purpose and application between an Application-Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) and a Field-Programmable Gate Array (FPGA)?
options: ASICs are programmed after manufacturing using a bitstream, while FPGAs require a full custom mask set for fabrication.
ASICs are optimized for high-performance and low-power in mass production, while FPGAs offer design flexibility and faster time-to-market for prototyping and lower volumes.
ASICs contain only combinational logic gates, whereas FPGAs exclusively use sequential logic elements like flip-flops.
FPGAs are purely analog circuits, while ASICs are exclusively used for digital processing.
ASICs are typically used for general-purpose computing, while FPGAs are restricted to embedded control applications.

questions.question: In the design of high-speed digital interconnects and PCB traces, what phenomenon refers to the bouncing back of a signal at points of impedance mismatch along a transmission line, which can lead to signal integrity issues like overshoot, undershoot, and ringing?
options: Crosstalk
Electromigration
Jitter
Signal Reflection
Ground Bounce
